meanings.definition: The ability of two or more substances to mix together without separating.
meanings.sent1: The miscibility of oil and water is well-known.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the miscibility of different liquids in the lab.
meanings.sent3: The miscibility of the paint colors made for a beautiful blend on the canvas.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship had a miscibility that was as seamless as mixing sugar into coffee.
meanings.sent5: The miscibility of the ingredients in the recipe was crucial for the dish to turn out right.

meanings.definition: The state of being capable of being mixed together.
meanings.sent1: The miscibility of the chemicals in the solution was impressive.
meanings.sent2: The miscibility of the colors in the palette allowed for endless artistic possibilities.
meanings.sent3: The miscibility of the team members' skills led to a successful project completion.
meanings.sent4: In their relationship, there was a miscibility of personalities that complemented each other perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The miscibility of the music genres created a unique and harmonious sound.
